content: shade|tree a cypresstextiles collaboration spring 2018 // issue 01 welcome note hello welcome to this collection of cypresstextiles patterns designed with a new theme for every issue it s a collaboration that celebrates the crafting community in every aspect we connect with talented featured artists choose from gorgeous scheepjes yarns and hand everything to the lovely members of the tester tribe my favorite part this series would not be possible without the talented artists who lovingly work up sample blankets take photographs for each design and give feedback to strengthen the pattern before publishing we love you what s inside this issue includes five blankets and four floral granny squares inspired by the art and nature photography of jessica wilkinson or vanillalemoncake on instagram after following her photography for just a short time i knew i wanted to design a set of patterns inspired by her colorful works and i m so proud to release this collection in the inaugural issue get the most out of shadetree when working through the five full blanket patterns you ll find that each one has a special technique published completely free of charge as a fully-photographed tutorial or video on my website under menu item shadetree advanced makers can use their preferred methods and beginners can head to this digital supplement to learn a new technique read through before beginning to learn more about what to expect meet me under the shadetree and we can create something beautiful together social media #ct_shadetree happy crafting rachele carmona pattern designer cypresstextiles net i jessica wilkinson | inspiration artist the creative behind instagram s @vanillalemoncake a r t i s t s f e a t u r e d teresa daily davis pattern tester and photographer sweet flatlay ariel jensen pattern tester and photographer birdsong makenzie pearson pattern tester and photographer indigo blossom amy mason pattern tester and photographer tiny garden gwen kok pattern tester and photographer 4 floral squares tiffany santos pattern tester and photographer colorburst v anilla l c emon ake nature photographer jessica wilkinson can take a pile of leaves and twigs from a tiny patio garden of potted plants and make it into a breath-taking photograph when i started following jessica vanillalemoncake on ig i thought she must have these giant acres of sprawling garden with infinite blooms then one day she made a garden tour instagram story and i was blown away you mean to tell me the incredible photos you see to the right are made with those completely normal potted plants now that is a mighty talent master wordsmith aside from her intricate drawings and gorgeous photography jessica writes a book- worthy passage in nearly all of her instagram posts she is quite the author i recommend having a read through her entertaining and endearing writings from all this inspiration my shadetree team and i bring you five bright blankets and four free floral motifs made with scheepjes yarns i hope y all enjoy them the standard chunk
